content:
We're about to go on the road, to OSCon in Austin (not confirmed, but likely), and PyCon in Portland! We likely have a booth at OSCon and have a 10' by 10' booth at PyCon.
a) If you're going to be at either one of those, definitely let us know!
b) We need a banner!

It'd be great to have both a horizontal banner (maybe 3' by 8'?) for the back of the booth and a vertical banner (6' by 3'?) for the front of the booth. We'll probably go with a matte cloth banner (screen printed), which is what the nicer banners are made out of.

Would anyone be interested in designing or helping design such a banner? You can see examples of banners by google image searching for "conference banner" and similar. (Though we can definitely be less corporate looking than average.) We can figure out the text later, mainly we're looking for the graphic elements of the design.

To start it off:
pasted image

Any ideas for maybe an illustration of a busy developer? Or a different slogan, or background?
Do we want to say "busy developers" vs. "busy teams"?
The plus of mentioning developers is that it makes people feel like it's for them. The downside is it makes it feel like it's not for the other people in your company.
Developers is good
I'm guessing most people at pycon are developers?
I guess for a banner at a tech conference, maybe we want the "for developres"
And we can always do something different on the website
Can I ask something?
go ahead
What is the banner for?
Zulip has a 10' by 10' booth at pycon!
Oh ok
You could change the colour
I agree, maybe a green tone similar to the one used in this the logo, or green letters on white background?
Dull green isn't really soo attractive and catching-the-eye sort of a colour

I agree, maybe a green tone similar to the one used in this the logo, or green letters on white background?

Yeah, that would be nice
I think a patterned background could look great. And agree, this isn't the right green, or the right font for the text.
You could also put a background, something related to zulip
... which also matches with the zulip logo or colour
I'm just suggesting, no prob if it isn't good
Or something related to PyCon and Python
like the python logo but in yellow and green colour along with the zulip logo in the same kind of colour combination as the snake on either ends and a blue or orange background
I like the idea of targeting developers during PyCon. For attention getting, I like having an orange octopus somewhere on the shirt.
Octopus on banner would also be great (drawing of a busy octopus?)
@Vaida Plankyte -- any chance you want to take a shot at an illustration for the banner? Maybe seaweed etc growing from the bottom, and then characters in the background somehow emblemizing busyness?
Another slogan idea: "chat without playing catch up". Doesn't scan as well, but on the plus side isn't as developer focused.
On the back of the shirt, "Stop falling behind on chat" would have a bit of double entendre, and then front could be "Zulip keeps you caught up" or similar.

Hey Steve, I don't want a joke about my behind on a shirt I'll be wearing in a professional capacity. :\ I like "Zulip keeps you caught up" and I like the idea of finding a lighthearted way to refer to chat backlogs and heaps of message notifications!
On the back could be "If you can catch up to me...", and then the front could "...you can catch up on chat."

I'm not sure I see the "joke about my behind" interpretation -- I was assuming Steve was referring to (1) the fact that if you're looking at someone's back, it's because you're behind them and (2) being behind in technology
Yeah, that's what I meant, but I can see the other interpretation, so I think something along the lines of "you need to stay caught up" is more obviously on message.

Hey guys. Here's a second-round draft of the banner for PyCon. Thoughts?

PyCon Banner Design
zulipchat.com is a better link than zulipchat.com/beta, since the next step for someone seeing this banner will be getting more information, not signing up
Looks nice!
what kind of banner did you end up going for in the end? :)
We went with essentially the banner that was posted above. I think it worked well for this conference, but it's worth brainstorming improvements!
Just changed the color to green to have the background work :)
i can imagine it must look really cool with the green background!
Yeah I think we tweeted a picture recently
If you want to see it
just checked! looks fab. i'm interested in trying to do something with a pattern background, maybe inverting the colours so there's more white. will do some mocks over the weekend!
